The company emphasizes responsible content handling while protecting minors.

Bears in the house: Polar giants chilling in abandoned Arctic station - see images
description: Remarkable drone footage reveals polar bears seeking refuge in an abandoned Russian research station on Kolyuchin Island. Photographer Vadim Makhorov captured these images, showcasing the bears' adaptability as their natural sea ice hunting grounds shrink. This unusual sight highlights the impact of climate change on Arctic wildlife and their interaction with forgotten human structures.

title: Goldman Sachs to employees: Expect more rounds of job cuts, ‘it’s become clear that…’
description: Goldman Sachs is preparing for another round of job cuts before year-end, aiming to achieve further savings and leverage efficiencies from artificial intelligence. Despite this, the bank anticipates an overall increase in headcount by the end of the year. The new "OneGS 3.0" strategy emphasizes AI's role in enhancing operational efficiency across various functions.

title: UPSC Essentials | Daily subject-wise quiz : Science and Technology MCQs on Regenerative medicine, Metal-Organic Frameworks and more (Week 132)
Karur stampede: Relief for TVK; 2 top party leaders get bail
description: TVK Karur district secretary V P Mathiazhagan and central town secretary Masi Pavunraj are set for release from jail after a court rejected the police's request for extended custody. Their arrests were linked to the tragic stampede at actor Vijay's rally in Karur on September 27, which resulted in 41 fatalities.

title: Dhruv Rathee questions Shah Rukh Khan about endorsement choices
description: YouTuber Dhruv Rathee has sparked a debate by questioning Shah Rukh Khan's endorsement of paan masala products, given the actor's substantial USD 1.4 billion net worth. Rathee argued Khan's wealth allows him to forgo such deals, while critics lauded the call for responsible influence. Counterarguments cited contract complexities and legal advertising frameworks.

description: Team India's departure for Australia showcased a positive transition with new ODI captain Shubman Gill embracing leadership.  Gill's camaraderie with Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli set an encouraging tone for the upcoming series, which marks the start of a new cycle towards the 2027 World Cup. Both Rohit and Kohli return to the ODI squad for the tour.

title: Tellis tale isn't a tell-all: Scholar charged for keeping top secret files - not spying
description: Renowned scholar Ashley Tellis faces charges for unlawfully retaining national defense information and undocumented meetings with Chinese officials. The FBI's investigation, triggered by surveillance, uncovered classified documents at his home. While the think-tank community expresses shock, many argue that meeting foreign officials is part of his role, though document handling is questioned.

title: After historic warm year , carbon-di-oxide levels in 2024 set new records: WMO
India's growth 'very strong': RBI guv dismisses Trump tariff worries; 'not a huge concern'
description: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra highlighted India's robust macroeconomic fundamentals and significant market depth during IMF meetings. He noted increasing capacity utilization and well-managed inflation, despite global uncertainties and policy shifts.  Malhotra also pointed to manageable fiscal deficit and strong growth projections, emphasizing orderly rupee movement.

title: ‘Only problem is windows don’t open’: Inside Dubai billionaire Satish Sanpal’s home in Burj Khalifa
ESPN’s Chris Russo reveals what really pushed Molly Qerim to quit First Take
description: Molly Qerim's abrupt departure from ESPN's First Take has sparked speculation. Chris Russo suggests she left to avoid perceived embarrassment from a quiet replacement, while Marcellus Wiley points to pay disparity and unapproved show ideas. ESPN's Burke Magnus confirmed contract talks failed, indicating Qerim sought a fresh start after a decade.

description: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent criticised China's new rare earth export restrictions as a "China versus the world" move, vowing allies will "neither be commanded nor controlled." He urged de-risking and diversifying supply chains away from China, while hinting at a potential tariff pause if Beijing delays its curbs.

title: Ahmedabad recommended as Commonwealth Games 2030 host
description: India's capital, Ahmedabad, has been recommended by Commonwealth Sport's Executive Board to host the 2030 Commonwealth Games. This marks the second time India will host the event, following the 2010 Delhi Games. The decision, pending formal confirmation in November, highlights India's growing sporting prowess and infrastructure capabilities.

title: Is Virat Kohli leaving RCB and retiring from IPL? 'He will play his last match ... '
description: Virat Kohli's future with Royal Challengers Bengaluru is secure. He has committed to playing for the franchise. Reports of him leaving are incorrect. Kohli has not signed a new commercial deal as he awaits potential changes in franchise ownership. He continues to be a key player for RCB and has promised to play his first and last match for Bengaluru.

Following a TNN investigation that revealed candidates holding seats elsewhere reappearing in the state merit list, 152 students have been asked to re-upload original documents by October 16. The move aims to curb seat-blocking and restore credibility in medical admissions.

Af-Pak clashes: 48-hr ceasefire declared after deadly skirmishes - who asked for truce first?
description: Pakistan and Afghanistan have agreed to a 48-hour ceasefire starting Wednesday evening, following a week of deadly cross-border clashes. This truce, requested by the Afghan Taliban, aims to de-escalate tensions and facilitate dialogue. The agreement follows Pakistan's precision strikes in Kandahar and Kabul in retaliation for attacks that claimed the lives of 23 Pakistani soldiers.

The nation confronts a 'Quad of Terror' including TTP, Baloch insurgents, IS-K, and elements within the Afghan Taliban. Border clashes with Afghanistan intensify.

description: The US passport has dropped to 12th place, its lowest ever, losing ground to Asian nations like Singapore and South Korea which now lead global travel freedom. This shift, driven by changing visa policies and growing Asian influence, means US citizens face more travel hurdles. European passports, meanwhile, continue to strengthen their international access.

title: What were Ashley Tellis' views on India, US, and China?
description: In his much-discussed 2025 essay “India’s Great-Power Delusions” in Foreign Affairs, Tellis argued that India’s ambitions far exceed its capabilities. New Delhi, he wrote, aspires to become a pole in a multipolar world but remains constrained by slow economic growth, limited military capacity, and weak institutions.

description: Australian surfer Ellie-Jean Coffey is facing death threats after a video of her urinating off a boat in Western Australia was falsely shared as her defecating in a sacred Indian lake. The 30-year-old clarified the mix-up, stating she has never been to India and the incident occurred in the Aussie outback, not Udaipur.

description: The father of Durgapur gang rape victim has sought forgiveness from Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee after previously criticizing her remarks on women's safety. He described Banerjee as a "mother-like figure" and pleaded for her help in securing justice for his daughter, urging her to forgive any harsh words spoken earlier.

description: Nitish Kumar's JD(U) has unveiled its first list of 57 candidates for the Bihar assembly elections, fielding 30 new faces alongside 27 incumbents. The party aims to retain power, balancing caste equations with a focus on OBC, SC, and EBC nominees. Notably, no Muslim candidates were included in this initial selection.

Both nations are committed to achieving a positive resolution.

description: Gymnastics icon Simone Biles inspired young athletes in Buenos Aires, emphasizing the strength in seeking help for mental health struggles. Her visit included motivational talks and a clinic, leaving a lasting positive impact.

Despite Trump's assertions, BRICS has expanded to 20 members, with Saudi Arabia being the only country to demur. India is set to chair BRICS in 2026, prioritizing developing nations' concerns.

The government has initiated investigations and compensation.

The US was China's largest customer for used cooking oil last year, highlighting the significant trade ties at stake amidst escalating tensions.

Both nations reported inflicting damage on the other's military assets, including tanks, weapons and posts. This escalation follows recent reciprocal strikes and ongoing disputes over border security and alleged militant harboring.

‘Mahabharat’ star Pankaj Dheer passes away at 68 after long battle with cancer
description: Veteran actor Pankaj Dheer, famous for playing Karna in 'Mahabharat', has sadly passed away at 68 after battling cancer. He was known for his strong acting in TV and movies. His son Nikitin Dheer and daughter-in-law Kratika Sengar are carrying on his acting tradition. Dheer's portrayal of Karna is truly unforgettable.

TCS layoffs: HR chief clarifies; ‘We are not chasing a target’
description: Tata Consultancy Services HR head Sudeep Kunnumal addressed layoff concerns. He clarified that TCS is not targeting job cuts but will evaluate all employees. The company has seen a 1% workforce reduction, with further evaluations planned for those who cannot be redeployed. Kunnumal also mentioned TCS's localized US workforce and adaptability to H-1B visa rule changes.

title: Indian-origin US adviser held: Why he’s under scrutiny; what FBI found at his home
description: An Indian-origin scholar, identified as Tellis, has been detained by US authorities on charges of unlawfully retaining over 1,000 pages of classified national defense information. The documents, marked "SECRET" and "TOP SECRET," were discovered at his Virginia home. Authorities also allege Tellis met with Chinese officials multiple times.

title: Jaisalmer bus tragedy: How vehicle bought 5 days ago became death trap
description: A private bus, recently converted to AC, erupted in flames near Jaisalmer, claiming 20 lives, including three children. A suspected short circuit in the AC system caused the rapid spread of fire, trapping passengers. Rescue efforts were hampered by intense heat. Investigations into the bus operator and modification are underway.

title: Kelly Stafford’s note to Hailee Steinfeld wins hearts across NFL
description: NFL star Josh Allen praised his wife Hailee Steinfeld. Matthew Stafford's wife Kelly Stafford shared Allen's interview, wishing every player had such support. Her message went viral, celebrating the quiet strength of spouses. This highlights the vital role partners play in the lives of football stars, both on and off the field.

title: Trade Rumor: Red Sox tipped to land $80M Phillies star to boost offense
description: Boston Red Sox are eyeing a reunion with powerful free agent Kyle Schwarber, a former fan favorite. A potential sign-and-trade could send outfielder Jarren Duran and a pitching prospect to Philadelphia. This move would inject much-needed power into Boston's lineup and offer the Phillies financial flexibility and defensive upgrades, creating a win-win scenario for both clubs.
